summary: This is a forwarded email from July 2, 2019, within the FBI, discussing the immediate response plan following Jeffrey Epstein's indictment in the Southern District of New York. It details the need to be on standby to arrest Epstein upon his return to the U.S., execute a search warrant at his NYC residence, interview co-conspirators, and deploy agents to Florida to serve subpoenas.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the indictment and arrest warrant; believed to be in France at the time of the email.

connections.description: M., as an FBI SSA, is coordinating the operational plan to arrest Epstein and execute related search warrants and interviews.

events.title: Epstein Indicted in SDNY
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York, and a warrant for his arrest was sworn out.

events.title: Planned FBI Agent Unavailability
events.description: An FBI agent notes they will be out of town from July 6-10, 2019, but free otherwise, in response to the call for availability for the Epstein operation.

locations: France (where Epstein is believed to be)
New York City, NY (location of Epstein's residence for the search warrant)
Florida (destination for agents to serve subpoenas and interview individuals)
Southern District of New York (SDNY) (jurisdiction of the indictment)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in the Southern District of New York on July 2, 2019, with an active arrest warrant.
At the time of the email, Epstein was believed to be in France, and the FBI planned to arrest him immediately upon his return to the U.S.
The FBI operational plan included executing a search warrant at Epstein's New York City residence and interviewing co-conspirators.
The FBI also planned to immediately deploy two agents to Florida to serve subpoenas and interview 1-3 individuals.
The email calls for the entire FBI squad, plus assistance, to be on standby as Epstein's return to the U.S. was unpredictable.
